title: Sea Safe platform
description:
Property management and marine industry have a common problem:

They are greatly based on hand labour and have long maintenance cycles.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal doesn't indicate how is is using metadata to solve the problem. How is metadata on a blockchain going to solve the problems of long maintenance cycles and hand labor in the marine industry and property management.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no detailed plan as to what is going to be done. Only $10 is being asked for. Please explain what is you intend to do, and how you intend to achieve it.
f6_assessments.q2: Please provide a plan on what you intend to do, and how success can be measured against that plan.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is very short and it is difficult to comprehend what is meant with so little information. 
To the proposer: You might have a great idea here, don't give up and provide us with more information. Don't be shy. Just throw it onto the table. If you don't know how, ask help from proposal mentors. Good luck!
f6_assessments.q1: There's not much to go on to determine the feasibility of this project proposal. The proposer claims relevant experience as a marine professional and developer of a maintenance app. Unfortunately, without a decent concept of what is trying to be solved, there is no way of verifying the relevancy to this particular project. It needs a plan.
f6_assessments.q2:
The amount of information in this proposal is close to none. Therefore it is not auditable. 
It needs a plan, links, logos, an explanation what SeaSafe is, a risk assessment, roadmap, etc... 
Reach out to people like proposal mentors to help you develop this idea into a proposal if needed.

f6_assessments.q0: Unfortunately, this proposal is very light on details. The proposer states: "Platform connects various entities (user groups) in the life of a product and governs interactions with it using metadata stored in smart c." In what way? Is this about making Maintenance records accessible via the Blockchain? Is this about logging hours or locations? How does this effect hand maintenance? How will this benefit the wide marine community? More specificity of the desired end state would be appreciated. This would convey the proposers goal more effectively to potential voters.
f6_assessments.q1:
Unknown. The proposer states "Developed maintenance app for professional use, designer of the SeaSafe concept" but there are no links or sites to verify the accuracy of the claim.

Also, the requested funding of $10 is curious. How will these funds be used? Who is on the proposers team to develop and deploy this solution. Where is the project roadmap to show the planned roll out? This seems very hastily put together and lacks important details for potential voters.
f6_assessments.q2:
I do not think the information is sufficient. There are too many missing key details. For the proposer: Please understand that better information can make voters more likely to support your project. This is increasingly important as the number of projects increase from one funding round to another.

(My Relevant Skills: 20+ Years in Aviation Maintenance and documentation)

f6_assessments.q0: Draft proposal. There is no understandable context for the problem, i would recommend to include more information. There is not enough information for impact assessment. I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a reference for a new proposal, more precisely the document proposal writing guide in the FAQ section on the IdeaScale Catalyst homepage.
f6_assessments.q1: Draft proposal. There is not enough information for feasibility assessment. I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a reference for a new proposal, more precisely the document proposal writing guide in the FAQ section on the IdeaScale Catalyst homepage.
f6_assessments.q2: Draft proposal. There is not enough information for auditability assessment. I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a reference for a new proposal, more precisely the document proposal writing guide in the FAQ section on the IdeaScale Catalyst homepage.

f6_assessments.q1: No detailed experience of the proposer has been given, lack of all basic proposal components like roadmap, detailed scope, metrics, budget, etc.
f6_assessments.q2: No for both, the given information is not sufficient to audit progress and success es.

f6_assessments.q0: The solution of this proposal touches upon the challenge though it lacks further information on how they plan to unroll the solution. The platform they speak of gives us no further hints on what it holds. They first speak of using the metadata but later on the proposer states that they will use NFT as items for users to collect. Given the comment from the proposer, I do feel like it could give a positive outcome to the Cardano network but we lack information for this. That is why I will stay neutral and await the next Fund.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer declares that they have 16 years of experience but provides no actual prove about this. We have no way of proving this. The budget plan and roadmap are missing, which is why we can't really assess what the proposer plans to do. Giving the lack of information I strongly disagree that this proposal will be implemented successfully. It would be best for the proposer to submit the proposal again at a later stage after some rework and give more details about the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Since no roadmap and milestones are given we only get a hint of what the proposer plans to do. In the comment section, we do see that the proposer intends to not update the proposal and plans to improve the proposal in the next fund. The solution to the problem is vaguely written and does not provide enough information for now to assess this. I hereby strongly disagree that this proposal provides us with sufficient information to assess.

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea is about gathering data of items from the marine industry and interconnect entities like manufacturer, owner insurance companies. Even if the problem description meets the challenge objective, the proposal misses information on what will be developed as a solution.
In the perspective of an application of a future round, the proposer should provide technical details about the solution and use case examples.
f6_assessments.q1:
The author of the proposal has experience in the field of the problem being raised, marine industry. More skills will be needed to reach the objective, starting by computing science. In a further application he should provide details on how those will be gathered/hired.
The proposal needs to be edited with more technical details and rationales. I also would advise the proposer to make a first functional description and assess the budget needed for development.
f6_assessments.q2: Without a minimum description of the product, it is not possible to exceed the minimum auditability skill for the project. For a further application, the author should include a development schedule and a split off budget.

solution: Platform connects various entities (user groups) in the life of a product and governs interactions with it using metadata stored in smart c.
experience:
Marine professional for 16 years, developer, entrepreneur. 

Developed maintenance app for professional use, designer of the SeaSafe concept
